markdownRemark.html:
One gripe I have had with OSX is that it seemed unnecessarily difficult to view hidden files. Luckily I found Ian Lunn’s article: Quickly Show/Hide Hidden Files on Mac OS X Mavericks

It is worth spending a minute setting up a terminal alias. Now showing or hiding files is as simple as entering ‘showFiles’ or ‘hideFiles’ in the terminal.

frontmatter.title: Show and Hide files on OSX easily
frontmatter.description: How to show and hide files on Mac OSX
